The problem has a solution. Please see #1992.. I have solved this problem.
First,I will show the error info here:
Command failed: G:\Docker Toolbox\docker-machine.exe -D create -d virtualbox --virtualbox-memory 2048 default,Docker Machine Version: 0.8.2, build e18a919,Found binary path at G:\Docker Toolbox\docker-machine.exe,Launching plugin server for driver virtualbox,Plugin server listening at address 127.0.0.1:13087,() Calling .GetVersion,Using API Version 1,() Calling .SetConfigRaw,() Calling .GetMachineName,(flag-lookup) Calling .GetMachineName,(flag-lookup) Calling .DriverName,(flag-lookup) Calling .GetCreateFlags,Found binary path at G:\Docker Toolbox\docker-machine.exe,Launching plugin server for driver virtualbox,Plugin server listening at address 127.0.0.1:13091,() Calling .GetVersion,Using API Version 1,() Calling .SetConfigRaw,() Calling .GetMachineName,(default) Calling .GetMachineName,(default) Calling .DriverName,(default) Calling .GetCreateFlags,(default) Calling .SetConfigFromFlags,(default) Calling .PreCreateCheck,(default) DBG | COMMAND: G:\VirtualBox\VBoxManage.exe --version,(default) DBG | STDOUT:,(default) DBG | {,(default) DBG | 5.1.8r111374,(default) DBG | },(default) DBG | STDERR:,(default) DBG | {,(default) DBG | },(default) DBG | Hyper-V is not installed.,(default) DBG | %!(EXTRA *exec.Error=exec: "vmms.exe": executable file not found in %PATH%)COMMAND: wmic cpu get VirtualizationFirmwareEnabled,(default) DBG | STDOUT:,(default) DBG | {,(default) DBG | VirtualizationFirmwareEnabled ,(default) DBG | TRUE ,(default) DBG | ,(default) DBG | },(default) DBG | local Boot2Docker ISO version: v1.12.2,Error with pre-create check: "read tcp 172.30.203.73:13151->54.231.81.88:443: wsarecv: An existing connection was forcibly closed by the remote host.",open C:\Users\Yang.docker\machine\machines\default\default\Logs\VBox.log: The system cannot find the path specified.,notifying bugsnag: [Error with pre-create check: "read tcp 172.30.203.73:13151->54.231.81.88:443: wsarecv: An existing connection was forcibly closed by the remote host."],
Because it has the space between 'Docker' and ' Toolbox' of "G:\Docker Toolbox\docker-machine.exe" , you can solve this problem use "X:\Docker Toolbox\docker-machine.exe" -D create -d virtualbox --virtualbox-memory 2048 default in terminal, just like this:

notice that we must enclose G:\Docker Toolbox\docker-machine.exe in quotation marks. If you adddocker-machine.exe in the PATH, you alse can usedocker-machine -D create -d virtualbox --virtualbox-memory 2048 default directly.
then enjoy Kitematic.
(P.S. I tested it in Kitematic-0.13.0-RC1, maybe you can be Kitematic-0.12.0 or other version.)
. @singhakash the docker default machine folder at C:\Users\<Your User Name>\.docker\machine\machines

Please remove default folder manually and then reinstall in terminal C:\DockerToolbox\docker-machine.exe -D create -d virtualbox --virtualbox-memory 2048 default.
If you network so bad, you could download boot2docker.iso manually and then put it into C:\Users\<Your User Name>\.docker\machine\cache folder (P.S. the installation process should be so fast) , the download link
C:\DockerToolbox\docker-machine.exe -D start default start docker in terminal or start it with Kitematic, then please lookup it in your vitualbox.

. @singhakash you could remove VirtualBox Host-Only Ethernet Adapter #3 in virtualbox and then reinstall docker default.

MonkeyTonk:
What happened to this one as I seem to be facing this issue?. ~~Second this. Same here. Kitematic version is 0.17.7~~. As mentioned in #1991 (or more specifically in comment https://github.com/docker/kitematic/issues/1991#issuecomment-247480423) this is due to the fact that docker (at the moment) cannot change portmappings of a configured container. It is a bit disguised by kitematic because what kitematic does it removes the current container, creates and starts a new container based on the same image. That's why the ID is also changing. 
As a solution kitematic could add a commit to this chain and remove the "temporary" created image (created through the commit).
Other workarounds can be found on stackoverflow or in a blog post.
Yes, it would be nice if docker had some "native" way of doing this but otherwise.. docker is not meant that way.
BUT I think @AlBundy33  has a point in 

if this is a limitation of docker it would be nice I[f] the user gets a warning.

Sorry for the inconvenience..

wildloop:
We solved this problem by uninstalling this software:

Antivirus/Ad-Aware - lavasoft.com:
LavasoftTcpService C:\Program Files (x86)\Lavasoft\Web Companion\TcpService\2.3.4.7\LavasoftTcpService.exe
WebCompanion C:\Program Files (x86)\Lavasoft\Web Companion\Application\WebCompanion.exe


cryptoCertum Scanner - certum.pl: C:\Program Files (x86)\Unizeto\proCertum CardManager\cryptoCertumScanner.exe

We don't know which one exactly helped... but in your case it could be something else.
So, you have to do some investigation on your own:

download and unzip Process Monitor 
stop any program that you don't need at this moment (to avoid hype)
run Process Monitor and start capturing all events
run Kitematic and wait for about 15 seconds
stop capturing (magnifier icon)
analyse logs... (use excluding/including filters, ctrl+f,...)

We found something like this:

Kitematic.exe, Operation: ReadFile, Path: C:\Windows\System32\LavasoftTcpService64.dll
Kitematic.exe, Operation: ReadFile, Path: C:\Program Files (x86)\Lavasoft\Web Companion\TcpService\2.3.4.7\LavasoftTcpService.exe
...


There is something else that may be helpful for someone. 
I our case Kitematic.exe showed the main window when was started as a windows service generated by Process Hacker (even while it didn't work as a normal windows process). But, Kitematic executed as a windows service didn't work properly with Docker/VirtualBox :(

HTH
Best regards from Lublin@Poland :).

ajlanghorn:
I don't know if that is a resolution; more that it's a workaround for your specific use case. registry-1.docker.io is signed by a certificate issued by RapidSSL, who are in turn signed by GeoTrust. The GeoTrust root CA is installed, usually by default, so I wonder whether or not your connections to the outside world are being mitm'd, and whatever under the hood that Kitematic uses to make a connection is realising this, and refusing to connect since the certificate presented back to Kitematic is different to the one that actually should be presented.
A better workaround, assuming the above, would be to get whatever egress proxy sits between you and the outside world to accept and properly pass back the certificate issued to registry-1.docker.io.
An option to disable SSL verification seems nasty to me, since it encourages bad behaviours and allows for excuses to thrive. Offering a HTTP version of the registry seems like a regression: the web is moving more and more toward accepting HTTPS by default. Kitematic shouldn't really introduce a regression unless there's a very valid and popular need to do so, which I don't think there is here..
mateodelnorte:
Yes, I'm behind a corporate firewall. But, no there is no prescribed proxy settings for users here. 
@ajlanghorn I agree it's not the perfect solution for a perfect world, but in reality there are thousands of developers stuck behind corporate firewalls where their IT departments have not property configured their network or firewall settings. As a result, they face the problems I'm facing and fixing network appliance settings, for instance, in a 200,000 person organization is a political problem far harder fought than just setting an environment variable to ssl-strict=false. . Frankly, I think this project should favor flexibility for the purpose of fueling adoption. But that's just my opinion, and as it stands and for the reasons above, I am having difficulty setting inroads for it at my very large organization. . I'm not following. If you're saying I should set up a proxy for my corporate firewall, as described here https://github.com/docker/kitematic/wiki/Common-Proxy-Issues-&-Fixes, I mentioned my org doesn't use one. To your point, because corp firewall settings are more difficult to navigate than flicking a switch in Kitematic, that's exactly why Kitematic should have a setting allowing it to be lenient in this case. 
npm allows exactly this: https://docs.npmjs.com/misc/config#strict-ssl
I guess what I'm pointing out here is that by electing to not offer an option to skip ssl validation, you're essentially saying that Kitematic only works within organizations that share Docker's security mentality. And, you're not providing a road map for improvement to those that currently don't. Something to keep in mind is that some organizations are incredibly large and changes start within them in small groups working to improve the larger structure. .

rick02840:
BTW Kitematic version is 0.12.0 and I got it by clicking the link in the Docker for Mac icon (the spouting whale icon at top of Mac window).  As I recall, a link to get Kitematic appears in a popup if you click the 'Open Kitematic" link in that Docker icon and you do not have Kitematic installed yet. 
^ so this may be the way to get Kitematic for Docker for Mac.  But note below it was asking for Virtual box at first.  
So anyhow...   shortly after I posted above I seem to have it running OK.  
At first it was asking for Virtual Box to be installed.  I did that, as I needed it anyhow.  Then Kitematic would start, but showed none of the containers I had created with docker-compose up.  Guessing because it is looking for containers in the VM not in Docker for Mac.
Anyhow, I shut down Virtual Box and started Kitematic again.  It briefly shows the screen when it is starting up the VM, but then loads the main interface and I can see the containers I had created.  So, guess it's working for now. 
I see Kitematic as sort of like a Git GUI - not necessary, since everything can be done on command line - but nice to have a visual of what's going on. .

bzm97:
A quick hack to get over this issue is to reset settings.useVM flag in LocalStorage.
Here's a Mac solution, I guess Windows\Linux should be somewhat the same (one just need to find out where Toggle Chromium Developer Tools menu item is located).
 Click top menu View > Toggle Chromium Developer Tools
 In the Developer Tools select Resources pane:

 Expand Local Storage section and select file:// node
 Edit settings.useVM value in the table to be false
* Restart the app.

ozc:
I've tried to retrace my steps and make it as easy as possible. But it needs to be checked. At least, the regex codes and the typo errors. Kitematic and electron version numbers need to be changed if necessary, too.
sudo dnf -y update
--Download kitematic tar.gz file
tar zxvf kitematic-0.13.1.tar.gz
cd kitematic-0.13.1
```
sed -ie 's/.("electron-version")(.)(".").$/\1: "1.6.0",/g' package.json
sed -ie 's/.("electron-prebuilt")(.)(".").$/"electron": "\^1.6.0",/g' package.json
sed -ie 's/.(var electron)(.);$/\1 = require(\x27electron\x27);/g' Gruntfile.js 
grep -Ril "import shell from 'shell'" ./src | xargs sed -ie 's/.*(import shell from \x27shell\x27)/import {shell} from \x27electron\x27;/g'
```
sudo dnf -y  install libXScrnSaver
sudo dnf -y install libcanberra-gtk3 libcanberra libcanberra-devel
make
grunt
--At this point Kitematic is compiled and running
--If you want to create a rpm
sudo dnf -y install rpm-build
grunt release
cd dist
sudo rpm -Uvh Kitematic_0.13.1_x86_64.rpm
-- If shows dependency errors:
sudo dnf -y install lsb
NOTE:
to fix console log on top of menu, before running make and grunt, edit styles/container-home.less file. You need to add margin-top:50px; so it will be like this:
.details-panel.home {
  background-color: @color-background;
  overflow: hidden;
  margin-top:50px;
  .content {.
riggerthegeek:
Does anyone know of a reason why this couldn't be incorporated into the main project so we get an .rpm release as well as a .deb?. > Edit: you will also need sudo dnf -y install rpm-build
A solution to this is actually much simpler than first I thought. Download the zip/tar.gz of the release you want, extract it and run the following commands.
sh
cd /path/to/kitematic
npm install
grunt release
This will create an RPM that you can install as you would normally.
You will need Grunt installed for this. I've done this using Grunt 0.4.5 and Grunt CLI 1.2.0.. > Edit: you will also need sudo dnf -y install rpm-build

ZeFifi:

EDIT: I found the solution. For those who wonder: 

open the mysql container settings

under the "General" tab click on the + icon and add : 


MYSQL_ROOT_PASSWORD as a key and what you want as a value

MYSQL_DATABASE as a key and what you want as a value
MYSQL_USER as a key and what you want as a value
MYSQL_PASSWORD as a key and what you want as a value

Then, save and go back to your Wordpress installation page and fill the fields with the data you set. Instead of localhost, copy/paste the "Access URL" provided in the "Home" tab (next to "Settings") when you're on your mysql container in Kitematic..

franky47:
Thanks, here's the solution that helped me for the record:
http://apple.stackexchange.com/questions/100384/how-to-get-open-file-selector-to-show-hidden-files
The trick is that file dialogs are not considered the same as Finder windows, therefore respond to different sets of properties..
mloder1337:
Had the same issue via corporate proxy. Fixed it via this method on Win7
1 Setup environment variables "HTTP_PROXY" and "HTTPS_PROXY"
2 Delete the 'C:\Users\ [username] \.docker\machine\machines\default' folder
3 Run command "docker-machine create -d virtualbox --engine-env HTTP_PROXY=YOURPROXY create -d virtualbox default"
4 Startup Kitematic like normal
I also had to kill VBox processes along the way
Hope this helps.
HyperBrain: I have the same issue. It seems that it is an IPv6 issue for me - The 500 error refers to [::1] instead of the IPv4 address. Is is possible to lock it to IPv4?. I have the same issue. It seems that it is an IPv6 issue for me - The 500 error refers to [::1] instead of the IPv4 address. Is is possible to lock it to IPv4?.

geoffroy-noel-ddh:
Why is this issue closed? 
Changing settings.useVM is the only way to make it work. Isn't the the red reset button supposed to solve the issue and give the option to go for 'native' docker?. The reset button doesn't solve #2499 (on MacOS). I had to use the useVM = false in the console to make it work.. I have the same issue. It is very annoying indeed as the user has to type slowly, making sure one key is ever pressed at one time.. Hi @FrenchBen , thanks for the response. 

By default docker will always try and use the latest image.

Actually 'latest' is a misleading concept in Docker! Kitematic will try the latest tag from 'My Images' screen. If 'latest' tag now points to a new Image on Dockerhub, well Kitematic will not try not pull the latest image because it has 'a' latest tag already.
Just to be clear, I'm not suggesting a completely automatic redeployment by Kitematic. The Feature Request could be split in two parts. Let's take the simplest case: the users have created a container based on image X:latest. I push a new 'latest' image on Dockerhub. At the moment there's no way for the users to know there's a new image. You can compare that with some traditional desktop apps that send the user a notification when a new version is ready to be downloaded (e.g. VirtualBox): either via regular polling or when the user explicitly asks whether a new version is available. Giving the user at least a way to check for new versions from Kitematic would be great.
The second part of the Feature Request is the simplification of the upgrade procedure. Right now if someone wants to upgrade a container, they have to: remove the container, search again for the image name (because the one in My Image will not allow them to pull new tags), and create a new Container from the Image they have found then possibly re-configure the the Container (e.g. port mapping, enabled volumes). Having a button to do all that with one click would be a great step forward; bringing Kitematic and Docker closer to what basic end users expect from a modern app or app store. At the moment I think it's 90% there, what's left doesn't look too difficult to implement logically as long as the mechanism are well designed.
My point for supporting this feature(s) is that Docker has an image versioning system built-in and I find it surprising that it's not better exploited by Kitematic at least to provide an experience that many users of desktop application expect from softwares that can be upgraded from the web.
.

For Mac Users:
In Terminal
rm -rf ~/Library/Application\ Support/Kitematic/Local\ Storage/
Then kill all processes of Kitematic:
(Manually or use following command)
kill $(ps aux | grep '.*Kitematic.*' | awk '{print $2}')
Restart Kitematic and select "New Setup".

There are several, and Microsoft provides IIS images for Linux and IIS for Windows respectively (microsoft/iis).  What is your Docker setup on your Windows machine?
You can have  a Linux host within your Windows machine as depicted here below.  To switch between machines, you will need to use eval(docker-machine env MACHINE_NAME) . Once you are using the right machine, you can then execute the docker run command to bring up the container.

You can have a Linux host within your Windows machine as depicted here below. To switch between machines, you will need to use eval(docker-machine env MACHINE_NAME) . Once you are using the right machine, you can then execute the docker run command to bring up the container.

What I did was using this script out of your Wiki:

set proxy=YOUR_PROXY
SET HTTP_PROXY=%proxy%
SET HTTPS_PROXY=%proxy%
for /f %%i in ('docker-machine.exe ip default') do set DOCKER_HOST=%%i
SET NO_PROXY=%DOCKER_HOST%
set DOCKER_HOST=tcp://%DOCKER_HOST%:2376
cd Kitematic
Kitematic.exe

I opened up a Thread to Ansible at that time. You can see what I did, here:

matheuslemke:
My problem was missing proxy config:
nano /etc/systemd/system/kitematic.service.d/proxy.conf
[Service]
Environment=http_proxy=http://host:port
systemctl restart snapd. My problem was missing proxy config:
nano /etc/systemd/system/kitematic.service.d/proxy.conf
[Service]
Environment=http_proxy=http://host:port
systemctl restart snapd.

when you start kitematic, click kitematic in menu bar then select preferences, make sure 'use VirtualBox instead' box is UNTICKED then close kitematic and restart and give that a try
also make sure docker is running FIRST in the menubar before you open kitematic. try this (THIS RESET SCRIPT WILL WIPE ALL DOCKER AND KITEMATIC DATA - RUN AT YOUR OWN RISK)

CLOSE KITEMATIC AND DOCKER completely (QUIT)
open terminal
Choose either 3A OR 3B
3A. wget https://raw.githubusercontent.com/docker/kitematic/master/util/reset && chmod a+x reset && ./reset
3B. curl https://raw.githubusercontent.com/docker/kitematic/master/util/reset | bash
(IGONRE LAST WARNING ABOUT VIRTUALBOX UNINSTALL)
open docker and let it get started
then open kitematic
. i simply did a google to factory reset docker and kitematic and came across the link and worked fine on my laptop but i only use docker once every so often for stuff, so not worried about deleting docker images, etc
if need be download/save the file then edit it and remove the docker lines and everything else should be fine :) . 1. Click NEW (left hand side near top)
Click My Images (right hand side near top)
Click the 3 dots next to the image you want to remove
Click 'DELETE TAG' and poof!
(wont be able to delete the tag.remove the image unless all containers using that image have been removed)
👍 .

TypedBit:
Open CLI
Type docker --help
This may already take long.
-- If you check docker icon you will see "Docker is switching" in case of long duration.
-- After the switch is complete you will see the help in console.
Type docker stop --help
This will definitely take long.
If you check docker icon you will see "Docker is switching"
Help will appear after switch is complete
Now if you type docker --help again it will also definitely take long as docker will be switching again....

Most if not all other applications correctly reference Windows' certificate store which has the required certificate imported.  That includes Docker for Windows(can pull/push/search etc.). I'm not sure what exactly kitematic is doing differently here :\  
Any help would be appreciated.

Chematronix:
I won't ask why can't you check which drives are shared, but surely would be better if the user were at least warned of this before hand?  I suspect nowhere in the docs it's mentioned that you will lose your container and its configuration for something like this;  most people don't bother reading the docs thoroughly; and even lovers of RTFM with photographic memory might simply get distracted and miss the popup.
Something along the lines of "Your mission, Admin, should you decide to Accept it, is to share your drive.  As always, should you be caught distracted, Kitematic will disavow any knowledge of your container or its configuration.  Your container will self-destruct in ten seconds.  Good luck, Admin." when Sharing Drives on Demand would do the trick. ;)
A little less aggravating, but leaving a non-functional ghost container in the GUI after failing to recreate it is also confusing. .

My company firewall uses its own certificate to monitor network traffic.
It needs to install self-signed certificate on my mac.

I checked a source, https://github.com/docker/kitematic/blob/master/src/utils/HubUtil.js#L150,  about login to dockerhub; 
I tested curl -XPOST https://hub.docker.com/v2/users/login/ on my terminal with(out) web proxy and cerificate verification is passed, which means a http settings(firewall) is right.
As I said, npm request package is used to make a http request.
There is no code about certificate settings in kitematic.
Look at the following link. https://www.npmjs.com/package/request#tlsssl-protocol

So use "npm run release:{yourPlataform}" to generate the .zip and other installers. Well, yes, there are some issues with this. This are the issues:
In order to build packages in the format of: msi, deb, pac, etc you have to build it in the SO that you are targeting.
MacOS can only build on MacOS
Linux is builded on any plataform (Remote compilation)
AppX only on Win10. Other Targets can be build on any Win.
To build for linux you exec "npm run release:linux" and for win you run "npm run release:windows", etc...
The best way is to use CIs to make the releases.
There is no way to fix this due SO issues, not related to kitematic, electron or electron-builder. Well, TS things are not related to electron-builder.
I can try to support the old release way, but the old way would not be compat with creating app packages. Well, there are a electron-builder images for building linux and win (not appx).
But i dont think there are any image for macOS.
I can try sto search some other solutions. Ok, I have added a package.script called "release:all-zip".
This should build only .zip for all plataforms (But it will only completely in MacOS due MacOS requirement).
Here is more information about building for all plataforms: https://www.electron.build/multi-platform-build

Yivan:
The patch could simply be:
In src/utils/DockerMachineUtil.js, line 24, replace:
return 'default';
by
return (process.env.DOCKER_MACHINE_NAME ? process.env.DOCKER_MACHINE_NAME : 'default');
It will allow all user which don't use default as VM name to be able to use Kinematic again.. Up please, someone here ? Could the patch be implemented for next release ?. Thanks @FrenchBen for your post.
Machinge get default machine name as default name, but it can be used with other names (docker-machine [command] [machine name]). Machine work great with other names.
Problem with Kinematic is it won't work at all with other names. default name is hardcoded on it and there is no way to indicate it to use another machine name. When Kinematic start if it don't find the default name machine, it even attempt to create it... : (
To answer to your question, i think if env var is set and machine is not found, it can do any of the following (by order of best preference):
- send an error message (i don't think it is the purpose of Kinematic to create the VM... so for me it is the best, and it give the developper the possibility to create manually the machine)
- create the machine with this name (like it does actually for default)
- create a default machine and use it
But the real problem in this issue is Kinematic cannot be used with machine with other name than default, and it limit its usablility. Docker Toolbox do not force to use default. You can create any new VM name you want with docker-machine.
And the patch is so easy to implement, and will bring so more to Kinematic, that actually i don't see any raison to not implement it. We don't talk about big code change here.. I undestand better thanks for the explaination.
I was not aware that:
- Kinematic cannot read Windows system/user environment variables
- Kinematic has the job to manage the VM (create, etc.) (i thought Kinematic was only to manage container in a docker instance)
- Kinematic has a "delete VM" policie if it don't manage to connect to VM
I am just not agree on you last sentence "default is the Kitematic preferred VM, and the one that should always be used for boot2docker things". It is more right to say Kinematic actually can only be used with default, this is not a preferred VM as there is no choice (and this is purpose of this issue which could be resolved i hope). For boot2docker, it has never been mandatory to use default, using another name works very great, just Kinematic don't handle it. In fact developpers could even have several boot2docker VM, this is the puprose of docker-machine, be able to create/manage multipe machine and so multiple boot2docker. Forcing it to only one VM called default is reducting. For instance, what about swarm in this case ? Or testing local cluster environment, etc...
I think if Kinematic cannot read windows environment the old patch could be reincluded (kinematic read a config file). To prevent machine deletion, if the VM kinematic try to start is not default, it could just report "Cannot connect" and that's all. It should not have an option to destroy and recreate... It is to the user to do it so VM cannot be deleted accidentaly. And we can consider that an user using not the default name is more advanced than a user staying on default so he know how to handle the problem.
What do you think of this approach?
p.s: does your deletion exemple apply to default too ? If i create a "default" VM for some project (imagine a CentOS VM) and start Kinematic it can destroy it ? If yes, deletion problem is not particularly tied to not use the default name for the VM in this case but more an other global issue i think.. I understand your reflexion and need to keep it simple. Thanks for taking time talking about this issue.
I hope somedays we could use kinematic with different host/VM name (like portainer does for instance).
.

emaballarin:
@LinArcX, I had right today the same problem as yours, and I have finally managed to solve it (somehow) in the way I will outline below. Just note that this is not entirely the way it should work. However, so far I have tested it, I experienced no problems.
Prerequisites:
- Docker
- Nodejs 9.x.y (that is one of these)
- Npm (the one bundled with Arch is fine)
- Grunt (the package is now called: grunt-cli)
- Git
- All you may want if you want to make a PKGBUILD out of it
Preparation:
- Unpack somewhere the Nodejs 9 release (you can safely delete it after the build process; let's call it $NODEDIR)
- git clone --recursive https://github.com/docker/kitematic.git somewhere else (let's call it $KITEDIR)
- Edit $KITEDIR/Gruntfile such that line (as of now) 224 which currently looks like
command: 'cd build && npm install --production'
then looks like
command: 'cd build && npm install --production --force'
- Perform, in the shell you will use for the build process:
export LD_LIBRARY_PATH="$NODEDIR/lib/:$LD_LIBRARY_PATH"
export PATH="$NODEDIR/bin/:$PATH"
Build process:
- cd $KITEDIR && npm install # may throw some errors
- cd $KITEDIR && npm run release # will throw some errors for sure
Distribution:
- The directory $KITEDIR/dist/Kitematic-linux-x64 is what should be put in $PKGDIR when distribution the package, and Kitematic is the executable.
CAVEATS:
This procedure worked for me just out of luck, because of the fact that the errors arising from the build process and partially suppressed by the --force switch did not interfere with the real build process but were only (as fas as I can tell and test) side effects of the fact that:
- this project officially targets Windows, Mac and Ubuntu (that it *.deb distribution files)
- there are some tslint deprecations in the project
I cannot tell if this project is dead, will die shortly or is in pre-death maintainance mode (at least for Linux-based OSs), but these steps are provided under the conditions of the just make it run, no matter what philosophy. I hope you can find them useful.
Good luck with the build! :wink: .

jackfruhecolab:
Same issue for me, windows 10 1809 release. 
Seems network related, works fine in cli. I did a bit more googling and this turned up:  https://forums.docker.com/t/docker-for-windows-beta-kitematic-doesnt-work/14300/7

About half way down the page, someone said they solved it by adding 127.0.0.1 docker.local to their c:\windows\system32\drivers\etc\hosts file.
Seemed worth a shot and it seemed to work!
. Dug deep and far on this one, seems this is resolvable by adding 127.0.0.1  docker.local to c:\windows\system32\drivers\etc\hosts then running once as administrator.
(I'm not even sure the run as admin part is needed but it was in the post I found, and I did it and it worked so I am including it here for completeness) . Dug deep and far on this one, seems this is resolvable by adding 127.0.0.1  docker.local to c:\windows\system32\drivers\etc\hosts then running once as administrator.
(I'm not even sure the run as admin part is needed but it was in the post I found, and I did it and it worked so I am including it here for completeness) .

Seems to be a problem with the "latest" tag on Docker Hub:
docker pull elasticsearch                                                                                                                                                                                                      
Using default tag: latest
Error response from daemon: manifest for elasticsearch:latest not found
docker pull elasticsearch:6.5.4                                                                                                                                                                                                6.5.4: Pulling from library/elasticsearch
-> that works. Seems to be a problem with the "latest" tag on Docker Hub:
docker pull elasticsearch                                                                                                                                                                                                      
Using default tag: latest
Error response from daemon: manifest for elasticsearch:latest not found
docker pull elasticsearch:6.5.4                                                                                                                                                                                                6.5.4: Pulling from library/elasticsearch
